description: Borrowed from Latin portendere (“to foretell”), from por- (“forward”) + tendere (“to stretch”), present active infinitive of tendo.

verbs.description: portend (third-person singular simple present portends, present participle portending, simple past and past participle portended)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To serve as a warning or omen of.

examples: Let it be known that the Rapture portends the End of Days.
